Comment: It should be obvious to anyone now, but in case it's not, DOGE does not know what it's doing.   There's no logic involved here.   There's no foresight, no accountability, no understanding of the systems they are dismantling.   It's a numbers game. X% of people need to go.   They're doing it without talking to the people in charge of these agencies. They are coming in and breaking things, then walking away leaving the broken parts for someone else to try and reassemble and do their jobs.   Because make no mistake, there are jobs that still need to be done.   I've said this before and I'll say it again. Doge is wasting far more money than it will ever save.
Author: thepartypantser

Comment: Yeah, that’s pretty much how it goes every time. They do buyouts or early retirement to save money, then realize they can’t actually function without enough people. Then they scramble to hire new staff who don’t know the job as well and spend even more on training.

Comment: When I worked at USDA there was a political appointee under Obama who did a version of this. She came up with a plan to reduce the agency through RIFs and buyouts. More employees left than expected and not in the areas she expected. Then they had to hire new people with no experience. It was clear to me then, that neither Democrats nor Republicans cared about the work the agency did. It was all about making the political appointee feel powerful.

Comment: Yes and no. They are deliberately doing some things, and they are looking to privatize certain aspects for sure.  They are also deliberately making it difficult for federal employees, but they do not understand all of the mechanisms they are breaking, and how it is truly damaging the country.  The teenage and 20 something DOGE incels certainly don't get the implications of destroying the diplomatic and soft power mechanisms, and I doubt Musk really grasps the damage he is doing to the US standing internationally either.   He genuinely thought he would be hailed as a hero, and yet Tesla is being likely irreparably damaged, and the power vacuum he made by the destruction of USAID and other diplomatic agencies, opens the door for China and their agenda's including chinese EV's to easily fill, all while tanking the market for Telsa.  That shows a lack of foresight and understanding.
Author: thepartypantser
